alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 4:18PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong Northwest Winds... Northwest winds will gust up to 40 mph at times in the wake of a strong cold frontal passage. The strong winds and temperatures dropping through the 30s and into the 20s will drive wind chills down into the teens. In addition, some flurries or light snow will be possible particularly northwest of a Washington to Iowa City to Manchester line. Little accumulation is expected, but with temperatures falling below freezing a few slicks spots will be possible with any precipitation. Use caution if driving a high profile vehicle, especially on north...south roadways, and if driving into any light snow.
